value.title: Power BI reports for consumers (end users)
value.excerpt: Adam walks through how to navigate and use Power BI reports for consumers, or end users. This is geared towards someone not really familiar with the Power BI interface or how to use Power BI reports to their fullest.  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/hbHs91E8MBw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI Tutorial: 4 Ways To Get Data
value.excerpt: In this Power BI tutorial, Adam looks at 4 ways to get data in Power BI. This focuses on Power BI Desktop and the main storage modes - Import, DirectQuery and Live Connections to Analysis Services. If you are new to Power BI, be sure to check out this Power BI Tutorial: 4 ways to get data.   Import (Excel)
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/sxx-z5hm-aE" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI Tutorial | Working with JSON data
value.excerpt: In this Power BI Tutorial, Adam shows how you can easily work with JSON data within Power BI. Working with JSON data in Power BI Desktop is one of the best-kept secrets of Power BI.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: Power BI XMLA Endpoint: Why you should care
value.excerpt: The XMLA Endpoint in Power BI can be very powerful. Adam looks at what it is and how to get started with it. If you are using Power BI Premium or Premium Per User, you need to know about this!  Live Stream Question: https://youtu.be/_SLFZiA3peU?t=1229  XMLA Endpoint Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/admin/service-premium-connect-tools

value.title: Rounding out the lakehouse with the GOLD layer in Azure Synapse
value.excerpt: We are completing the journey of our lakehouse with our GOLD layer in Azure Synapse. This gives you the table structures you need to start building those amazing reports in Power BI!  Stijn Wynants https://twitter.com/SQLStijn  üì¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************

value.title: Sharing and Collaboration in Power BI
value.excerpt: Adam looks at the different sharing and collaboration items within Power BI. From the share button to apps and embedding options. Power BI offers many options.  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton -- http://twitter.com/patrickdba -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: Slicers vs. Slicer Pane vs. Filter Pane! Which is faster?
value.excerpt: You have different options in Power BI when it comes to slicers and filters. Just put the slicer on the report, use a slicer panel or have them in the filter pane. But which one is faster??? Patrick explores a few scenarios to think about!  Should you hide the filter pane in Power BI? https://greyskullanalytics.com/should-you-hide-the-filter-pane-in-power-bi/

value.title: Start your Power BI journey with Guy in a Cube
value.excerpt: Want to learn Power BI from the masters?   Coming from Microsoft Excel and not sure where to start? Or, maybe you've used Power BI but want to make sure you are doing the right thing. Guy in a Cube has a course for you!  Power BI Blueprint: A step-by-step guide to creating report with Power BI.  https://guyinacu.be/courses

value.title: The Power BI Smart Narrative visual is INSANE AMAZING!
value.excerpt: The smart narrative visual can help tell the story in your Power BI report. Justyna Lucznik joins us to explore the visual and to illustrate how you can generate text about your data.  Make sure you have the September 2020 version of Power BI Desktop, or later.  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/visuals/power-bi-visualization-smart-narrative

value.title: Tracing with Log Analytics and Power BI
value.excerpt: With Log Analytics integration in Power BI, you can now capture Analysis Services trace events easily and over a longer period of time. Combined with the Power BI template report, you can gain a lot of insights into usage of your datasets. With more to come down the road!  Announcing long-term usage

value.title: Using Images from a Database in Power BI
value.excerpt: We've looked at images from sources like OneDrive and the web with your Power BI reports. What about from a database? Is that possible? Patrick takes a look at how you can do it.  SQLJason Blog:  http://sqljason.com/2018/01/embedding-images-in-power-bi-using-base64.html  Gerhard's Blog: https://blog.gbrueckl.at/2018/01/storing-images-powerbi-analysis-services-data-models/

value.title: Using Power BI reports from an end user perspective (2021)
value.excerpt: Just an end user of Power BI? Consuming reports and not authoring at all? Adam walks through how to navigate and use Power BI reports. Jump in and get familiar with reports in Power BI!  Reports in Power BI https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/consumer/end-user-reports  View a report in the Power BI service

value.title: Visualize Graph Data in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you wondered how to visualize graph data? No, not Microsoft Graph. Graph Networks! Adam shows you how you can do this in Power BI Desktop. value.title: What the heck is USERPRINCIPALNAME in Power BI? (Row-Level Security)
value.excerpt: Ever wonder what USERPRINCIPALNAME is in DAX within Power BI? Or the difference between USERPRINCIPALNAME and USERNAME? Hint - It's used with Row-Level Security. value.title: What's the real size of your data model in Power BI?

Well, it depends! Marco Russo joins Patrick to explain.  üì¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************

value.title: Add Leading Zeros to a Number in Power BI Using Power Query
value.excerpt: There are a lot of situations where you need to add some leading zeros to a number. A common example of this is to create a month-year combination code using both month and year, and making sure the month is always two digits, regardless of being 1 or 12. There are many different ways of doing that in
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Xf1oNtIzy0s" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Adding Pre Calculated Rank in Power BI Using Power Query
value.excerpt: There are multiple ways that you can add a RANK column to your table, You can do that dynamically inside the Power BI report using DAX Measures, or you can do it pre-calculated. If you are doing a pre-calculated rank (let‚Äôs say for an aggregated table or something like that), then it would be perhaps

value.title: Basic Sharing, and Manage Permissions in Power BI Simple, but Useful
value.excerpt: Power BI provides multiple ways of sharing content with users. Each sharing method has pros and cons and can be used for specific scenarios. Some of the sharing methods can be used together to build a framework for sharing. In this post, I will talk about the most basic way of sharing Power BI content.
